title: Associate Actuary, AIM Models
content:
Job Summary
The primary focus of this position is to provide support in the development of new actuarial models at F&G. This role involves collaborating with multiple teams to ensure accurate data input and output in the models, as well as integration with analysis tools and the general ledger. Independent testing of new models, troubleshooting, and effective analysis and communication of results are integral responsibilities of this role. Moreover, this position plays a vital role in the modernization of our processes.
Duties and Responsibilities

Support large model development projects, such as, but not limited to new product launches, new reserving regulation, and new reinsurance deals.
Conduct thorough testing of new actuarial models and implement model governance controls to ensure adherence to actuarial model governance policies.
Meet project milestones and contribute to delivering project status updates to senior management.
Demonstrate an in-depth comprehension of the newly developed model while providing technical support to other teams.
Collaborate within the Actuarial Moderization team and with actuaries from different areas of the company

Experience and Education Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Actuarial Science, Math, Statistics or other related area
ASA designation
2+ years of related actuarial experience
Experience with and knowledge of GGY-AXIS preferred or similar actuarial modeling software is required
Experience within the Registed Indexed Linked Annuity, Fixed Indexed Annuity, Indexed Universal Life or Pension Risk Transfer lines of business, as well as reinsurance preferred
Experience with modeling applications that calculate or project US statutory and US GAAP quantities (e.g., Valuation, Pricing, Asset Liability Management, Cash Flow Testing)

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Proactive individual who can provide strong technical support to other teams with respect to actuarial models
Self-starter who demonstrates strong initiative
Strong problem-solving skills that include advanced analytical and reasoning abilities; demonstrated ability to apply actuarial principles to complex situations
Possess strong technical skills including the ability to independently implement changes and troubleshoot issues
Team player who has the ability to function as a key member of a small group, demonstrated by the ability to proactively identify issues and to influence key project decisions
stablish and maintain strong internal relationships within the company
Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)
Ability to learn and utilize actuarial software systems
Effective verbal and written communication skills; strong presentation skills a plus

Other Requirements

Perform other functions, duties and projects as assigned
Regular and punctual attendance
Ability to travel up to 10%

#LI-JB1
#LI-Remote
 Additional Information 
Work Environments
F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.
Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers
About F&G
Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.
As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.
1Top Workplaces USA 2022 – 2023 
2Des Moines Register Top Workplaces 2018 – 2022
